pub_created_display: Ardashir I (224 to 240), BI, Group / Mint C ("Ctesiphon")
issue_place_s: Group / Mint C ("Ctesiphon"), Asuristan, Sasanian Empire
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: crown cap edged with a row of pearls, star in the center of lateral field, surrounded by zigzag design, one outer row of pearl; diadem, pendent diadem ribbons; cheek-flaps; tunica with one cross-like device; row of pearls on neck-cutout; dotted border
issue_obverse_legend_s: 11 h l. o. mzdysn bgy 'rthštr MRKAn MRKA 'yr'n| mazdēsn bay Ardašir šāhān šāh Ērān|"the Mazda-worshiping, divine Ardashir, King of Kings of the Iranians"
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of two elements; round altar shaft; four altar slabs; altar flames depicted with vertical strokes; to the left and right mushroom-shaped bases supporting lion-paw structures; below left and right edge of altar table pendent diadem ribbon; dotted border
issue_reverse_legend_s: 11 h l. o. NWRA ZY- 2 h l. i. 'rthštr | ādur ī Ardašīr | “the fire of Ardashir”
